form.longName: PhenX PX021603 - Waist Circumference Framingham Heart Study
form.preferredDefinition: Waist circumference is measured at several body sites in the scientific literature. This protocol is from the Framingham Heart Study in which measurement of the participant's waist circumference is performed at the level of the umbilicus (i.e., navel or "belly button"). Although this protocol is still used in surveys and studies, care should be taken in using it because it does not rely on reliable bony landmarks and is biased by degree of abdominal obesity. On the other hand, unlike the protocols that require palpation for bony landmarks (which may be problematic with some populations), an umbilicus is visualized or can be located through thin clothing. In both children and adults and compared with measurements taken using other protocols, measurements taken at the level of the umbilicus tend to be roughly comparable with those taken midway between the lowest rib and iliac crest (NCFS protocol) if the participants are at a normal weight, but measurements tend to be more comparable with or even larger than those taken over the iliac crest (NHANES protocol) when the participant is obese and the umbilicus has been displaced downward (i.e., pendulous abdomen). The relationship of this measure with cardiometabolic risk factors is, however, comparable with waist circumference measures taken at other sites. NOTE: Waist circumference can be measured on pregnant women. However, national reference data do not include pregnant women, and waist circumference has different associations with abdominal and total body fat among those who are not pregnant.

question.questionText: With the subject standing upright with feet together, arms hanging loosely at sides, and weight evenly distributed, did the examiner take the subject's hospital gown from the back, place it over the shoulder, place the anthropometric tape at the level of the umbilicus, applying the tape snugly but not tightly, making sure the tape was on a horizontal plane and ask the patient to fully relax their shoulders before taking measurement? (waistcircumference_framingham_procedural_method)
px21603 waist circumference exhibit 3 (px21603_waist_circumference_exhibit_3)
What was the waist measurement? (waistcircumference_framingham_measurement_1)
What was the waist measurement? (waistcircumference_framingham_measurement_2)
What was the waist measurement? (waistcircumference_framingham_measurement_3)
What was the average waist measurement? (waistcircumference_framingham_average)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Waist circumference is measured at several body sites in the scientific literature. This protocol is from the Framingham Heart Study in which measurement of the participant's waist circumference is performed at the level of the umbilicus (i.e., navel or "belly button"). Although this protocol is still used in surveys and studies, care should be taken in using it because it does not rely on reliable bony landmarks and is biased by degree of abdominal obesity. On the other hand, unlike the protocols that require palpation for bony landmarks (which may be problematic with some populations), an umbilicus is visualized or can be located through thin clothing. In both children and adults and compared with measurements taken using other protocols, measurements taken at the level of the umbilicus tend to be roughly comparable with those taken midway between the lowest rib and iliac crest (NCFS protocol) if the participants are at a normal weight, but measurements tend to be more comparable with or even larger than those taken over the iliac crest (NHANES protocol) when the participant is obese and the umbilicus has been displaced downward (i.e., pendulous abdomen). The relationship of this measure with cardiometabolic risk factors is, however, comparable with waist circumference measures taken at other sites. NOTE: Waist circumference can be measured on pregnant women. However, national reference data do not include pregnant women, and waist circumference has different associations with abdominal and total body fat among those who are not pregnant.

form.longName: PhenX PX021701 - Serial Pregnancy Weight Weights Abstracted From Prenat
form.preferredDefinition: Serial measures of weight either (1) abstracted from health care (prenatal) records or (2) measured prospectively for the duration of gestation. Data collected entail (1) weights measured at all prenatal visits; (2) dates of all prenatal visits; (3) reported pre-pregnancy weight; (4) reported or measured height; and (5) gestational age at every prenatal visit and at delivery. If the opportunity exists to collect the gestational weight prospectively as part of the research protocol, this is preferred because weights taken using a research protocol are better standardized for amount of participant clothing and scales are regularly calibrated.

headerInstruction.text: Weights Abstracted from Prenatal and/or Labor and Delivery Charts: Most obstetric practices and prenatal clinics use a standardized form to chart prenatal course. The American Congress of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG, formerly the Ame..TRUNCATED

protocol.longName: Serial Pregnancy Weight - Weights Abstracted from Prenatal Charts
protocol.preferredDefinition: Serial measures of weight either (1) abstracted from health care (prenatal) records or (2) measured prospectively for the duration of gestation. Data collected entail (1) weights measured at all prenatal visits; (2) dates of all prenatal visits; (3) reported pre-pregnancy weight; (4) reported or measured height; and (5) gestational age at every prenatal visit and at delivery. If the opportunity exists to collect the gestational weight prospectively as part of the research protocol, this is preferred because weights taken using a research protocol are better standardized for amount of participant clothing and scales are regularly calibrated.

form.longName: PhenX PX021702 - Serial Pregnancy Weight Weights Measured During Gestat
form.preferredDefinition: Serial measures of weight either (1) abstracted from health care (prenatal) records, or (2) measured prospectively for the duration of gestation. Data collected entail (1) weights measured at all prenatal visits; (2) dates of all prenatal visits; (3) reported pre-pregnancy weight; (4) reported or measured height; and (5) gestational age at every prenatal visit and at delivery. If the opportunity exists to collect the information prospectively as part of the research protocol, this is preferred.

protocol.longName: Serial Pregnancy Weight - Weights Measured During Gestation
protocol.preferredDefinition: Serial measures of weight either (1) abstracted from health care (prenatal) records, or (2) measured prospectively for the duration of gestation. Data collected entail (1) weights measured at all prenatal visits; (2) dates of all prenatal visits; (3) reported pre-pregnancy weight; (4) reported or measured height; and (5) gestational age at every prenatal visit and at delivery. If the opportunity exists to collect the information prospectively as part of the research protocol, this is preferred.

form.longName: PhenX PX030301 - Alcohol 30 Day Quantity And Frequency
form.preferredDefinition: Measurements of respondent's 30-day quantity and frequency of consumption of alcohol.

question.questionText: Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL*], up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you drink one or more drinks of an alcoholic beverage? * DATEFILL is the date 30 days prior to the date of the interview. (alcohol_30day_frequency)
alcohol 30day frequency coded (alcohol_30day_frequency_coded)

On the days that you drank during the past 30 days, how many drinks did you usually have each day? Count as a drink a can or bottle of beer a wine cooler or a glass of wine, champagne, or sherry a shot of liquor or a mixed drink or cocktail. (alcohol_30day_quantity)
alcohol 30day quantity coded (alcohol_30day_quantity_coded)
Definition of a standard drink: 1 12oz bottle of beer, 1 glass 4oz nonfortified wine, 1 mixed drink with 1oz liquor. (alcohol_30day_desc_2)

If respondent needs a visual reference for the size of a drink, the flashcards from the Wave 1 National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions (NESARC) study are provided below: (alcohol_30day_desc_3)
Card 1A. Cooler ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_4)
Card 1B. Cooler ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_5)
Card 1C. Cooler ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_6)
Card 2A. Wine ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_7)
Card 2B. Wine ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_8)
Card 2C. Wine ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_9)
Card 3A. Liquor ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_10)
Card 3B. Liquor ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_11)
Card 3C. Liquor ounce size (alcohol_30day_desc_12)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurements of respondent's 30-day quantity and frequency of consumption of alcohol.

form.longName: PhenX PX030501 - Alcohol Lifetime Abuse And Dependence
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's symptoms of alcohol abuse and dependence. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (4th ed.; DSM-IV).

question.questionText: At what age did you begin to drink regularly that is, drinking at least once a month for 6 months or more? (regular_drinking_age)
At what age did you begin to drink regularly that is, drinking at least once a month for 6 months or more? (regular_drinking_age_coded)
How old were you the first time you got drunk, that is, your speech was slurred or you were unsteady on your feet? (first_drunk_age)
How old were you the first time you got drunk, that is, your speech was slurred or you were unsteady on your feet? (first_drunk_age_coded)
In your lifetime, what is the largest number of drinks you have ever had in a 24hour period (including all types of alcohol)? (largest_drinking_24hour)
In your lifetime, what is the largest number of drinks you have ever had in a 24hour period (including all types of alcohol)? (largest_drinking_24hour_coded)
Did you ever become tolerant to alcohol that is, you drank a great deal more in order to get an effect, or found you could no longer get high on the amount you used to drink? (alcohol_tolerant)
WAS INCREASE 50% OR MORE? (alcohol_half_increase_same_effect)
Did you ever find you could drink a lot more before you got drunk? (alcohol_more_get_drunk)
WAS INCREASE 50% OR MORE? (alcohol_half_increase_get_drunk)
Have you 3 or more times wanted to stop or cut down on drinking? (alcohol_withdrawal_3times)
Have you ever tried to stop or cut down on drinking? (alcohol_cessation)
5.2 How many times were you unable to stop or cut down? (alcohol_withdrawal_failure_times)
How many times were you unable to stop or cut down? (alcohol_withdrawal_failure_times_coded)
Was it 3 or more times? (alcohol_withdrawal_failure_3times)

Have you ever started drinking at times you promised yourself that you wouldn't, or have you ever drunk more than you intended? For example, when you decided to drink 2 drinks and ended up drinking 4 or more? (alcohol_more_than_intended)
Did this happen 3 or more times? (alcohol_more_than_intended_3times)
Have you ever started drinking and become drunk when you didn't want to? (drunk_not_intended)
Did this happen 3 or more times? (drunk_not_intended_3times)
Have you ever given up or greatly reduced important activities while drinking like sports, work, or associating with friends or relatives? (alcohol_use_interfere_activity)
Did this happen 3 or more times or for a month or more? (alcohol_use_interfere_activity_3times)

Has there ever been a period of several days or more when you spent so much time drinking or recovering from the effects of alcohol that you had little time for anything else? (alcohol_use_interfere_life)
Did this period last for a month or more or did you have 3 or more periods like that? (alcohol_use_interfere_life_3times)
There are several health problems that can result from long stretches of drinking. Did drinking ever cause you to have liver disease or yellow jaundice? (alcohol_use_liver_disease)
There are several health problems that can result from long stretches of drinking. Did drinking ever cause you to have stomach disease or make you vomit blood? (alcohol_use_stomach_disease)
There are several health problems that can result from long stretches of drinking. Did drinking ever cause you to have pancreatitis? (alcohol_use_pancreatitis)
There are several health problems that can result from long stretches of drinking. Did drinking ever cause you to have damage to your heart (cardiomyopathy)? (alcohol_use_cardiomyopathy)

There are several health problems that can result from long stretches of drinking. Did drinking ever cause you to have memory problems even when you weren't drinking (so, not counting blackouts)? (alcohol_use_memory_problems)
There are several health problems that can result from long stretches of drinking. Did drinking ever cause you to have any other physical health problems? (alcohol_use_other_health_problems)

There are several health problems that can result from long stretches of drinking. Did drinking ever cause you to have any other physical health problems? IF YES, SPECIFY (alcohol_use_other_health_problems_specify)
Did you continue to drink knowing that drinking caused you to have health problems? (alcohol_continue_use_health_problems)

instruction.text: ([largest_drinking_24hour] > 3 or ([regular_drinking_age_coded] <> '00' or [first_drunk_age_coded] <> '00')) and ([alcohol_use_liver_disease] <> '1' or [alcohol_use_stomach_disease] <> '1' or [alcohol_use_pancreatitis] <> '1' or [alcohol_use_..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Have you ever continued to drink when you knew you had any (other) serious physical illness or condition that might be made worse by drinking? (alcohol_continue_use_worse_problems)

instruction.text: ([largest_drinking_24hour] > 3 or ([regular_drinking_age_coded] <> '00' or [first_drunk_age_coded] <> '00')) and ([alcohol_use_liver_disease] = '1' AND [alcohol_use_stomach_disease] = '1' AND [alcohol_use_pancreatitis] = '1' AND [alcohol_use_..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Has drinking ever caused you emotional or psychological problems like feeling depressed or uninterested in things for more than 24 hours to the point that it interfered with your functioning? (alcohol_use_depressed_interfere_functioning)

Has drinking ever caused you emotional or psychological problems like feeling jumpy or easily startled or nervous for more than 24 hours to the point that it interfered with your functioning? (alcohol_use_nevous_interfere_functioning)

Has drinking ever caused you emotional or psychological problems like having such trouble thinking clearly for more than 24 hours that it interfered with your functioning? (alcohol_use_clearthinking_interfere_functioning)

Has drinking ever caused you emotional or psychological problems like feeling paranoid or suspicious of people for more than 24 hours to the point that it interfered with your relationships? (alcohol_use_paranoid_interfere_functioning)
Has drinking ever caused you emotional or psychological problems like hearing, seeing, or smelling things that weren't really there? (alcohol_use_hallucination)
Did you continue to drink after you knew it caused you any of these problems? (alcohol_continue_use_problems)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you have the shakes (hands trembling)? (alcohol_withdrawal_shake)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Were you unable to sleep? (alcohol_withdrawal_sleepless)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel anxious? (alcohol_withdrawal_anxious)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel depressed or irritable? (alcohol_withdrawal_depressed)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did your heart beat fast or did you sweat? (alcohol_withdrawal_heartracing)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you have nausea or vomiting? (alcohol_withdrawal_nausea)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel physically weak? (alcohol_withdrawal_weak)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you have headaches? (alcohol_withdrawal_headaches)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you see or hear things that weren't there? (alcohol_withdrawal_hallucination)

People who cut down, stop, or go without drinking after drinking steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down or went without drinking, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Were you fidgety or restless? (alcohol_withdrawal_restless)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? (alcohol_withdrawal_multiple_symptoms)

instruction.text: [largest_drinking_24hour] > 3 or ([regular_drinking_age_coded] <> '00' or [first_drunk_age_coded] <> '00') OR ([alcohol_withdrawal_anxious] = '5' OR [alcohol_withdrawal_depressed] = '5' OR [alcohol_withdrawal_heartracing] = '5' OR [alcohol_..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Did you have the shakes (hands trembling)? (alcohol_withdrawal_shake_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Were you unable to sleep? (alcohol_withdrawal_sleepless_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Did you feel anxious? (alcohol_withdrawal_anxious_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Did you feel depressed or irritable? (alcohol_withdrawal_depressed_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Did your heart beat fast or did you sweat? (alcohol_withdrawal_heartracing_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Did you have nausea or vomiting? (alcohol_withdrawal_nausea_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Did you feel physically weak? (alcohol_withdrawal_weak_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Did you have headaches? (alcohol_withdrawal_headaches_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Did you see or hear things that weren't there? (alcohol_withdrawal_hallucinations_other_symptoms)
Was there ever a time when two or more of these problems occurred together? Which ones? Were you fidgety or restless? (alcohol_withdrawal_restless_other_symptoms)
Have you ever taken a drink to keep from having any of these problems (or to make them go away) (REVIEW ALL 5'S CODED IN COL. 1)? (drinking_alleviating_alcohol_withdrawal_symptoms)
Did this happen 3 or more times? (drinking_alleviating_alcohol_withdrawal_symptoms_3times)

When you stopped, cut down, or went without drinking, did you ever have fits, seizures, or convulsions, where you lost consciousness, fell to the floor, and had difficulty remembering what happened? (alcohol_withdrawal_seizure)
On 3 or more different occasions have you taken a drink to keep from having fits, seizures, or convulsions or to make them go away? (drinking_alleviating_alcohol_withdrawal_seizure_3times)

When you stopped, cut down, or went without drinking, did you ever have the DT's, that is, where you were very confused, extremely shaky, felt very frightened or nervous, or saw things that weren't really there? (alcohol_withdrawal_dt)
On 3 or more different occasions have you taken a drink to keep from having the DT's or to make them go away? (drinking_alleviating_alcohol_withdrawal_dt_3times)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's symptoms of alcohol abuse and dependence. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (4th ed.; DSM-IV).

form.preferredDefinition: Measurement of whether respondent has ever consumed alcohol.

headerInstruction.text: The next question is about drinking alcohol. This includes coolers, beer, wine, champagne, liquor such as whiskey, rum, gin, vodka, scotch, or liqueurs, and also any other type of alcohol.

question.questionText: In your entire life, have you had at least 1 drink of any kind of alcohol, not counting small tastes or sips? (lifetime_use)
Definition of a standard drink: 1 12oz bottle of beer, 1 glass 4oz nonfortified wine, 1 mixed drink with 1oz liquor. (lifetime_use_desc_2)

If respondent needs a visual reference for the size of a drink, the flashcards from the Wave 1 National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions (NESARC) study are provided below: (lifetime_use_desc_3)
Card 1A. Cooler ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_4)
Card 1B. Cooler ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_5)
Card 1C. Cooler ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_6)
Card 2A. Wine ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_7)
Card 2B. Wine ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_8)
Card 2C. Wine ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_9)
Card 3A. Liquor ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_10)
Card 3B. Liquor ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_11)
Card 3C. Liquor ounce size (lifetime_use_desc_12)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement of whether respondent has ever consumed alcohol.

form.longName: PhenX PX030201 - Alcohol Age Of First Use
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age of initiation of first use of alcohol and duration of use.

question.questionText: The next question is about drinking alcohol. This includes coolers, beer, wine, champagne, liquor such as whiskey, rum, gin, vodka, scotch, or liqueurs, and also any other type of alcohol. About how old were you when you first started drinking, not counting small tastes or sips of alcohol? (alcohol_first_use_age)

The next question is about drinking alcohol. This includes coolers, beer, wine, champagne, liquor such as whiskey, rum, gin, vodka, scotch, or liqueurs, and also any other type of alcohol. About how old were you when you first started drinking, not counting small tastes or sips of alcohol? (alcohol_first_use_age_coded)
Cooler ounce size image 1 (first_use_desc_1)
Cooler ounce size image 2 (first_use_desc_2)
Cooler ounce size image 3 (first_use_desc_3)
Cooler ounce size image 4 (first_use_desc_4)
Cooler ounce size image 5 (first_use_desc_5)
Cooler ounce size image 6 (first_use_desc_6)
Cooler ounce size image 7 (first_use_desc_7)
Cooler ounce size image 8 (first_use_desc_8)
Cooler ounce size image 9 (first_use_desc_9)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age of initiation of first use of alcohol and duration of use.

form.longName: PhenX PX030401 - Alcohol Maximum Drinks In 24 Hours
form.preferredDefinition: Lifetime measurement of the largest number of drinks respondent has consumed. The PhenX Working Group modified this question from the source so that it is compatible with the Alcohol - Lifetime Use measure. The original question defined the time period for maximum consumption as the last year.

question.questionText: The next question is about drinking alcohol. This includes coolers, beer, wine, champagne, liquor such as whiskey, rum, gin, vodka, scotch, or liqueurs, and also any other type of alcohol. What was the LARGEST number of drinks that you ever drank in a single day? (alcohol_max_drinks_1day)
Cooler ounce image 1 (max_desc_1)
Cooler ounce image 2 (max_desc_2)
Cooler ounce image 3 (max_desc_3)
Cooler ounce image 4 (max_desc_4)
Cooler ounce image 5 (max_desc_5)
Cooler ounce image 6 (max_desc_6)
Cooler ounce image 7 (max_desc_7)
Cooler ounce image 8 (max_desc_8)
Cooler ounce image 9 (max_desc_9)

The next question is about drinking alcohol. This includes coolers, beer, wine, champagne, liquor such as whiskey, rum, gin, vodka, scotch, or liqueurs, and also any other type of alcohol. What was the LARGEST number of drinks that you ever drank in a single day? (alcohol_max_drinks_1day_coded)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Lifetime measurement of the largest number of drinks respondent has consumed. The PhenX Working Group modified this question from the source so that it is compatible with the Alcohol - Lifetime Use measure. The original question defined the time period for maximum consumption as the last year.

form.longName: PhenX PX030701 - Tobacco Age Of Initiation Of Use Adolescent
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age of initiation of first/regular use of cigarettes, which can be used to calculate duration of use and pack-years measures.

module.longName: Tobacco Age Of Initiation Of Use Adolescent
module.preferredDefinition: Tobacco Age Of Initiation Of Use Adolescent

question.questionText: How old were you the first time you smoked part or all of a cigarette? (first_cigarette_smoking_age)
How old were you the first time you smoked part or all of a cigarette? (first_cigarette_smoking_age_coded)
How old were you when you first started smoking cigarettes every day? (adolescent_first_cigarette_smoking_everyday_age)
How old were you when you first started smoking cigarettes every day? (adolescent_first_cigarette_smoking_everyday_age_coded)

protocol.longName: Protocol 1: Tobacco - Age of Initiation of Use (Adolescent Protocol)
protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain the respondent's age of initiation of first/regular use of cigarettes, which can be used to calculate duration of use and pack-years measures.

form.longName: PhenX PX030902 - Tobacco Age Of Offset Of Use Adult Protocol
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain when the respondent quit smoking. Response is used to calculate duration of use and pack-years measures and allows one to distinguish recent quitters from long-time quitters.

module.longName: Tobacco Age Of Offset Of Use Adult Protocol
module.preferredDefinition: Tobacco Age Of Offset Of Use Adult Protocol

question.questionText: About how long has it been since you COMPLETELY quit smoking cigarettes? (smoking_cessation_time_number)
About how long has it been since you COMPLETELY quit smoking cigarettes? (smoking_cessation_time_number_coded)
About how long has it been since you COMPLETELY quit smoking cigarettes? (smoking_cessation_time_unit)

protocol.longName: Protocol 2: Tobacco - Age of Offset of Use (Adult Protocol)
protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement to ascertain when the respondent quit smoking. Response is used to calculate duration of use and pack-years measures and allows one to distinguish recent quitters from long-time quitters.
